WRITING.TEXT: I took out the card, thanks for the advice :)
Thanks! I'm glad you got the Innistrad vibe from Preacher, that's what I was shooting for.

Thank you very much but I've already contacted Wizards twice, with no response. This is not an uncommon thing - I met one of the artists working on cards currently and she said she sent her work in 3 times with no response before finally making art for them.
Thanks, yes, you make good points. Originally he had Flash as well. Perhaps he should just have been a 2/1 Flash, First Strike? Regardless, I am glad you like the art.

WRITING.TITLE: My artistic take on some MTG cards

WRITING.TEXT: Oddly enough I have made several illustrations in the hopes of doing art for them.
Thanks, I might just have to let you, running out of room in my apartment he he.
Thank you :) Probably the best advice is just to paint - a lot.

WRITING.TITLE: One of my paintings - "Lost", Oil on Canvas, 44" x 62"

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you very much for the kind words. Glad you enjoy my work :)

WRITING.TITLE: A painting of mine - "Shed", Oil on Canvas, 36" x 48"

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you for checking it out, I'm glad you like my work. I don't have any shows coming up currently, but I will let you know if I do :)
Yes, I'd be happy to sell a print. Thank you for taking an interest in my work. If you want something up to 11" x 17", that would be around $10-$15 plus shipping and handling.

Thank you. Yes, I have several places where you can view my work. If you prefer darker stuff - http://www.aritopia.com/purge.html My Facebook Art Page - https://www.facebook.com/aritopia/photos_stream?tab=photos_albums My website - http://www.aritopia.com/ My digital work - https://www.artstation.com/artist/nuclearwarrior My Instagram - https://instagram.com/aritargownik/

WRITING.TITLE: An oil painting I made, 16" x 12".
Sad Clown, Digital Speed Paint (30 min), 960x637 pixels

WRITING.TEXT: I'm not sure how many people notice Paul, but I'm glad you did. Thanks!
Thank you, I used Photoshop for this.

WRITING.TITLE: Dracula, a digital painting I made

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you so much. I'm glad you can appreciate the work, many cannot ha ha.
Since I can't sell it in either case, I can send you a high resolution version for you to print at your leisure.
I don't know if that's true, you might be correct, I just don't know.
This did not win.
Not all of my paintings are creepy, no. This is part of a series that is meant to be more visceral.
Many people think it is an aborted fetus, which is understandable. But I meant it to be a newly born, screaming, something, lying on some sort of medical table perhaps.
Thank you - this is an oil painting - 8" x 10".

I will take that as a compliment, so thank you. I have paintings that are "pretty" but there's plenty of people that do that well, and better than me. The body of work this painting is part of was an attempt to do something different.
Thank you. It's part of a series of paintings where that is pretty much the desired reaction.
Used it, it works :)
Had to google that one, he he.
Thanks, I would like to do an album cover at some point.
Thank you very much :) It is part of a series, here is a link to the rest of them: [http://www.aritopia.com/purge.html](http://www.aritopia.com/purge.html)
I do, but I haven't sold any of this type of work yet. Just landscapes, still life, etc. More traditional stuff.
What's up
Never seen that build for Ace, cool :)
